name: Mount Isolation

trails_config.name: Rocky Branch & Isolation Trail
trails_config.description: A long and aptly-named hike. Starting from the Rocky Branch Trail, hikers travel deep into a quiet valley, often using a bushwhack (Engine Hill) to avoid multiple river crossings. The Isolation Trail and Davis Path then lead to the summit spur. Mount Isolation’s summit is a small rocky clearing that miraculously provides a tremendous view—Mount Washington and the southern Presidential ridge dominate the skyline. This full-day trek is prized for its solitude, and is often done as an overnight or long day by experienced hikers.

current_conditions.ai_summary: Experience the beauty of New Hampshire on Mount Isolation. At 4004 feet, this summit commands impressive views of the surrounding wilderness.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 4004 feet, Mount Isolation is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its rugged and challenging terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Rocky Branch & Isolation Trail**, a **14.6 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Pierce**, which is just 2.5 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
